meanings.definition: To store or keep (wine or other alcoholic beverages) in a cellar.
meanings.sent1: I cellared the wine in the basement for aging.
meanings.sent2: The winemaker cellared the vintage wine for several years.
meanings.sent3: The wine decided to be cellared in the cool cellar for a relaxing time.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past were cellared in the depths of his mind.
meanings.sent5: She carefully cellared the precious bottles, ensuring they were safe and sound.
